Description: Bronze male figure in Egyptian dress and pose; he stands with his right hand along the side and his left fist to his chest; he wears a short kilt with a central panel and a belt: details such as the splaying folds of the cloth and the lines and circles of the belt are incised; the pointed cap or helmet ends in a small knob, a smaller version of the imitation crown of Upper Egypt; the toes are also incised; the right leg is slightly cracked below the knee; figure cast in lost-wax technique.
Curator's comments: See also Masson, 'Kypriaka VII: Le sanctuaire d'Apollon à Idalion (Fouilles 1868-1869)', BCH 92 (1968), pp. 386-402, for details of site context and other bronze figurines from Idalion, esp. 393-396.
Bibliographic references: Reyes 1992 / The anthropomorphic statuettes of archaic Idalion (cat. no. 16, p. 247 & pl. 16(a))
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Robert Hamilton Lang
